abstracts.cdata!:
The Ghana Community-Based Rural
            Development Project aims to strengthen the capacity of rural
            communities to enhance their quality of life by improving
            their productive assets, rural infrastructure and access to
            key support services from private and public sources There
            are five project components: (a) Institutional Strengthening
            and Capacity Building strengthens governance and functional
            capacities of the Ministry of Local Government and Rural
            Development, Regional Planning Coordinating Units, and
            District Planning Coordinating Units to deliver cost
            effective services to rural communities; (b) Infrastructure
            for Agricultural Development supports the provision of water
            for agriculture, rural transport infrastructure and
            post-harvest facilities to enhance farm and non farm rural
            activities; (c) Rural enterprise development establishes
            community owned and managed businesses and micro-enterprises
            to create avenues for skills development and job creation;
            (d) Infrastructure for Social and Human Development
            rehabilitates existing schools, construction of community
            health compounds and nutrition centers and potable water for
            communities to enhance well-being and reduce water borne
            diseases; and  (e) Community-based natural resource
            management builds the capacity of communities and district
            assemblies to enhance environmental governance and
            integrated management of land and water resources.
